summary: Comprehensive architecture and 46-task implementation plan for AI-powered trading system with: (1) Content ingestion layer (YouTube/PDF → LLM strategy extraction), (2) Pattern detection engine (candles, market structure, S/R zones, multi-TF confluence), (3) Visual backtester with WebSocket replay, (4) Learning loop for self-improvement, (5) Hyperliquid live trading via MCP. Tech stack: Python/FastAPI backend, SvelteKit frontend with TradingView charts, PostgreSQL/TimescaleDB, Claude API. Estimated 4-5 weeks with parallel execution across 11 phases.

Review REQUEST_CHANGES - 9 issues found

findings.issue: Import error: trades export not found
findings.fix: Change import to use allTrades from backtest store or filteredTrades from trades store

findings.issue: Multiple implicit any types on parameters in derived store callbacks and map functions
findings.fix: Add explicit types: decision: {trade_id: TradeId; reasoning: string; timestamp: string; trade?: Trade}, t: Trade, a,b: same type, d: same type, tp: number

findings.issue: TradeLog component receives trades prop but component does not define it in Props interface
findings.fix: Either pass trades through the store or add trades prop to TradeLog component

findings.issue: Readonly array being assigned to mutable type
findings.fix: Change variable type to readonly StrategyRule[] or spread to new array

findings.issue: selectedStrategy possibly null - missing null check
findings.fix: Add null check before using selectedStrategy properties

findings.issue: Uses any type in sort callback
findings.fix: Use proper typing for aVal/bVal instead of any

findings.issue: Uses deprecated createEventDispatcher - Svelte 5 prefers $props callbacks
findings.fix: Consider migrating to callback-based events for Svelte 5 compatibility

findings.issue: Uses deprecated createEventDispatcher - Svelte 5 prefers $props callbacks
findings.fix: Consider migrating to callback-based events for Svelte 5 compatibility

findings.issue: CSS @apply warnings from Tailwind - harmless but noisy in svelte-check
findings.fix: Consider using postcss lang or adding lang="postcss" to style blocks

Review REQUEST_CHANGES - 6 issues found

findings.title: Tests import from non-existent modules
findings.description: tests/unit/test_position_tracker.py imports from hl_bot.trading.position_tracker (does not exist). Should import from hl_bot.trading.position. tests/unit/test_risk_manager.py imports from hl_bot.trading.risk_manager (does not exist). Should import from hl_bot.trading.risk.

findings.title: Candle.is_doji property not implemented
findings.description: Tests expect Candle.is_doji property (or method) but it does not exist in hl_bot.types.Candle. Test file calls it as is_doji() but even as a property it is missing. This was noted in the pattern review.

findings.title: RiskConfig attribute renamed but tests not updated
findings.description: RiskConfig.max_position_size was renamed to max_position_size_usd but tests still reference the old name. Test file: tests/trading/test_risk_manager.py:78

findings.title: MCP server tests use wrong mock type
findings.description: test_mcp_server.py passes Mock(spec=HyperliquidClient) where a string private_key is expected. The Mock object doesnt have startswith method causing 11 test errors.

findings.title: RiskManager.get_risk_status() missing daily_loss key
findings.description: Tests expect daily_loss key in risk status dict but implementation returns daily_pnl instead. Either update implementation to include daily_loss or update tests.

findings.title: OHLCV validation error message doesnt match test expectation
findings.description: test_validate_ohlcv_invalid_low expects Low in error message but gets High must be >= open, close, and low

findings.issue: Test file imports from non-existent module `hl_bot.trading.position_tracker`. Should import from `hl_bot.trading.position`. Also references non-existent `PositionState` class (should use `Position`) and `Fill` class has different field names than implementation.
Test file imports from non-existent module `hl_bot.trading.risk_manager`. Should import from `hl_bot.trading.risk`. References non-existent `CircuitBreaker` class.
Test calls `doji.is_doji()` but `is_doji` is a property, not a method. Should be `doji.is_doji` without parentheses.
Test uses `config.max_position_size` but the actual field is `max_position_size_usd`.
Multiple tests reference incorrect API - need to update test assertions to match actual RiskConfig field names.
No test suite configured for frontend. Consider adding Vitest for component/unit testing.
All API tests are skipped (marked as app not fully implemented). Should enable when API is ready.

Builder spawned: Security review of API and trading components

Phase watcher triggered build: 1 ready tasks to spawn
Phase watcher triggered build: 1 ready tasks to spawn
Review REQUEST_CHANGES - 0 issues found

critical.description: allow_origins=["*"] allows any origin to make requests. This is a critical security vulnerability that enables CSRF and data exfiltration attacks.
User-supplied values (symbol, start_date, end_date) are passed directly to subprocess.Popen command arguments. While shell=True is not used, malformed inputs could cause issues.
critical.recommendation: Add strict validation: symbol should match ^[A-Z]+-[A-Z]+$ pattern, dates should be validated as ISO format before passing to subprocess.

high.description: All endpoints are publicly accessible including destructive operations like DELETE /api/data/clear. No API key, JWT, or session authentication implemented.
high.recommendation: Implement authentication middleware. At minimum, add API key auth via Authorization header or X-API-Key. Example: use FastAPI Depends() with an auth function.

high.description: Hardcoded default: postgresql://hlbot:hlbot_dev_password@localhost:5432/hlbot. Should not have working credentials as defaults.
high.recommendation: Remove default or use clearly non-functional placeholder like postgresql://user:password@host/db

high.description: The .env file exists with placeholder secrets. While .gitignore excludes .env.*, the root .env appears to be tracked.
high.recommendation: Ensure .env is in .gitignore, commit only .env.example with dummy values.

medium.issue: Error Messages May Leak Internal Details
medium.description: Exceptions are passed directly to HTTP responses: HTTPException(detail=f"Import failed: {str(e)}"). Could leak file paths, SQL errors, or stack traces.
medium.recommendation: Log full error internally, return generic message to client: HTTPException(detail="Import failed. Check server logs for details.")

medium.description: No rate limiting on public endpoints. Could allow DoS through repeated data imports or WebSocket connection spam.
medium.recommendation: Add rate limiting middleware (e.g., slowapi or custom). Limit: 100 req/min per IP for general endpoints, 10/min for imports.

medium.description: No authentication or connection limits on WebSocket endpoints. Could lead to resource exhaustion.
medium.recommendation: Add connection limit per session and authentication. Track connections in ConnectionManager with max limit.

positive: Trading components (risk.py, hyperliquid.py) follow security best practices: Decimal for money, circuit breaker, daily loss limits, audit logging, rate limiting on exchange API
SecretStr used for private keys in config - properly hides from logs
Comprehensive .gitignore for secrets, credentials, and sensitive files
Hyperliquid client has proper retry logic, exponential backoff, and 30% headroom on rate limits
Position monitoring has proper state management and WebSocket reconnection
Risk manager validates every order through multiple pre-trade checks

message: Phase watcher triggered build: 1 ready tasks to spawn
Review REQUEST_CHANGES - 396 issues found
findings: SECURITY REVIEW: 2 critical, 3 high, 3 medium issues. Critical: CORS wildcard (allow_origins=*), subprocess with user input. High: No API authentication, default DB credentials, .env tracked. Medium: Error message leakage, no rate limiting, unlimited WebSocket. Positive: Trading components well-secured with risk manager, circuit breaker, audit logging. Must fix auth and CORS before production.
